properties.name: includeHtml
properties.description: Whether the message should also be included as HTML

properties.name: htmlMessage
properties.description: The HTML message body

properties.name: message
properties.description: The message body. If HTML formatted, then you have to add and activate the option "HTML content" in the "Additional Options" section.

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: The email addresses of the recipients

options.name: toList
options.description: The email addresses of the recipients

options.name: ccList
options.description: The email addresses of the copy recipients

options.name: bccList
options.description: The email addresses of the blind copy recipients

options.name: attachmentsUi
options.description: Name of the binary property containing the data to be added to the email as an attachment. Multiple properties can be set separated by comma.

values.name: property
values.description: Name of the binary property containing the data to be added to the email as an attachment. Multiple properties can be set separated by comma.

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: Prefix for name of the binary property to which to write the attachments. An index starting with 0 will be added. So if name is "attachment_" the first attachment is saved to "attachment_0"

options.name: dataPropertyAttachmentsPrefixName
options.description: Prefix for name of the binary property to which to write the attachments. An index starting with 0 will be added. So if name is "attachment_" the first attachment is saved to "attachment_0"

options.name: format
options.description: Returns the full email message data with body content parsed in the payload field

options.name: Full
options.description: Returns the full email message data with body content parsed in the payload field

options.name: Metadata
options.description: Returns only email message ID, labels, and email headers

options.name: Minimal
options.description: Returns only email message ID and labels; does not return the email headers, body, or payload

options.name: RAW
options.description: Returns the full email message data with body content in the raw field as a base64url encoded string; the payload field is not used

options.name: Resolved
options.description: Returns the full email with all data resolved and attachments saved as binary data

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

options.name: Minimal

options.name: includeSpamTrash
options.description: Whether to include messages from SPAM and TRASH in the results

options.name: labelIds
options.description: Only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

options.name: q
options.description: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid:<somemsgid@example.com> is:unread". Parameter cannot be used when accessing the api using the gmail.metadata scope.

options.name: Remove
options.action: Remove a label from a message

For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid:<somemsgid@example.com> is:unread". Parameter cannot be used when accessing the api using the gmail.metadata scope.

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Stop Workflow
options.description: Halt execution and fail workflow

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
